newsitem.title: POLAND: POLISH LOT SELL-OFF DEADLINE EXTENDED TO 1998.
newsitem.headline: POLISH LOT SELL-OFF DEADLINE EXTENDED TO 1998.

text.p: The Polish government on Wednesday moved a deadline for a partial sale of the national air carrier LOT SA to June 30, 1998 from December 31 this year, the government press office said in a statement.

"The deadline for the privatisation of this company cannot be met because of complexity of the privatisation procedure and a need to secure means to cover costs of the privatisation, analses and evaluations," it said.
Earlier this year, the transportation ministry annuled a tender for LOT's privatisation adviser, saying bidders had asked to be paid to high fees.
The government has earlier said it wants to partially sell LOT next year.
Under a special bill on LOT's privatisation, the government can sell up to 49 percent of shares in LOT. The company has said it would prefer several passive investors and not a single strategic one.
